content.definition: Sudden constriction of an artery causing decreased blood flow and potential ischemia. Can occur as primary phenomenon (Raynaud, coronary spasm) or secondary to manipulation, trauma, or drugs. Distinguished from structural stenosis by reversibility and response to vasodilators.

types.primary_vasospasm: Functional, no underlying structural disease (Raynaud's, Prinzmetal angina)

clinical_pearls: Vasospasm mimics true arterial occlusion but is reversible
Radial artery especially prone to spasm (smaller caliber)
Always consider spasm before thrombectomy in young patients
Cerebral vasospasm peaks days 4-14 after SAH
Intra-arterial nitroglycerin + verapamil effective for catheter-induced spasm
